## GAD-7 vs BFI

The Generalized Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7) and The Big Five Inventory (BFI) are two remarkable psychological tools used widely to assess general anxiety and personality facets, respectively. However, "GAD-7 vs BFI" comparison can entail meticulous work in matching items across both instruments. This is where Harmony comes in, a software revolutionizing this process through the power of AI. Harmony simplifies the process of "GAD-7 vs BFI" comparison by using advanced Natural Language Processing and generative AI models. It can provide a percentage match between items in both questionnaires, saving you the time and effort of manual cross-referencing. Furthermore, it encompasses multilingual support, bringing added value to studies with a diverse range of demographics. We highly recommend psychologists and researchers to leverage Harmony for "GAD-7 vs BFI" comparison and beyond, making the most out of your longitudinal studies. With Harmony, harmonisation is no longer a tedious process but a seamless, user-friendly experience. Simply visit [Harmony's web interface](https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app) and elevate your research process today.

## Compare the items in GAD-7 English and BFI

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import GAD-7 and BFI into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just GAD-7 into Harmony</a> - compare GAD-7 English with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just BFI into Harmony</a> - compare BFI with other instruments


## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
